page.title: 16Ickwell Bury
page.content: {Ickwell Bury}takes its name from the village it overlooks.Ickwell means{ {five wells}and Bury means a {fortified {place.}Ickwell Bury was once fortified by the earthworks which are still to be seen today.Ickwell Bury was a {17th {century corolinian mansion}until it was burnt down by a madman in{1937}and only a little of the original mansion remains.The house was then rebuilt by the{Wells family},but now it is owned by the{Harpur Trust.} In the grounds is a superb octagonal dovecot which is in fine condition. The 150 acre site has a man made lake,farm and a horse grazing area. Bedford Modern School use part of the grounds as a field study area . The main building is now used as a health centre where guests may reside for varying periods of time.
